Well pen0r, it doesn't matter what you make the cd with, it still isn't going to boot on a PC.

More importantly, ThePirateBay has separate sections for Apps and games, if you aren't able to get the torrent in the right section, you likely aren't going to do well making the ISO either.

You may have just brought the definition of "hopeless PC user" to a new low.
Good luck
pen0r, you silly person...

You should try burning in Disk Utility as it can create bootable CDs. Just a thought. Also, you can try Toast Titanium if you want to stay on a Mac.

Also, it wasn't mentioned so I thought I should: This will not run on any Intel Mac. OS9 is not supported on any Intel Mac so if you want to run it you'll have to do so via virtualisation. If you're virtualising on a Mac you don't need to burn this just use the disk image to install with.
Exactly what i needed thanks, pen0r

well antamony, we all humans know for a fact that a MAC cd will not simply boot an a PC at all, this particular ISO file was created on a MAC so that PC users could simply load it on UltraISO (on their pcs of course) then Burn a CD that they could "Load and Boot On a MAC" so they could easily update, install or do anything they need to do with it. Reading and understanding is what its all about, using some Logic wouldnt hurt that one either. As for the "section, apps, game" thing, just remember "It's not WHERE you look for it, it's how GOOD, Wisely and Patiently you look for it". So antamony, If YOU found this torrent, then i could assure you the rest of the "hopeless PC users" would find it too regardless of section or category (do you know how to search for exact words?).
For the ones who found some benefit on this one, you're all welcome.
Good Luck.

Scottyarch, I tried Disk Utility a few mins ago and to my surprise it did gave me an ISO file which loaded on UltraISO with no problems at all, after i burned the CD and load it on my G5 it would NOT run the the installation automaticly, you will have to double click the setup.exe to start it. I did a research and found out that 2nd party image progs (like Disk-utility) wont keep the pre-arranged scheme of order (meaning that the selected boot file, in this case 'setup.exe', will lose its title as the BOOT file on the transfer process from DMG to ISO) on some cd-roms including OS roms. For this ISO I used HDiUtil which is a native prog on MacOSX. Havent tried Toast Titanium yet, and for the INTEL MacOSX's, YES it's true, you cant downgrade an intel based mac to 9.2 at all, but you can run 9.2 on a virtual drive from the CD itself. 
Good luck everyone.
